question_type: Multiple Choice Question with Single Answer
solution: Look at the first model. It shows 3 out of 4 equal parts colored, which represents $\frac{3}{4}$.
Look at the second model. It shows 1 out of 4 equal parts colored, which represents $\frac{1}{4}$.
Both models have the same size and are divided into 4 equal parts. This means each part in both models is the same size.
Since the parts are the same size, 3 parts are greater than 1 part. Therefore, $\frac{3}{4}$ is greater than $\frac{1}{4}$.

Both models have the same size and are divided into 5 equal parts. This means each part in both models is the same size.
Since the parts are the same size, 4 parts are greater than 1 part. Therefore, $\frac{4}{5}$ is greater than $\frac{1}{5}$.
